content.author: Charles R. Swindoll
content.text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.

content.author: William E. Gladstone
content.text: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.

content.author: Maurice Switzer
content.text: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.

content.author: Jim Rohn
content.text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.

content.author: Bob Monkhouse
content.text: When I die, I want to go peacefully like my grandfather did–in his sleep. Not yelling and screaming like the passengers in his car.

content.author: Someone in a bar
content.text: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down “happy.” They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.

content.author: Alan Rickman
content.text: If only life could be a little more tender and art a little more robust

content.author: Mencius
content.text: Only when there are things a man will not do is he capable of doing great things.
